frameDefinitions: This frame characterizes the likelihood that a Hypothetical_event will happen as a position on a scale of impossible to inevitable.
A Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of Authorities in relation to a Crime which the Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.
A Gambler commits an Asset to a prediction that an Uncertain_situation will have a particular Outcome (or class of outcomes).
An Agent moves Goods (or some other useful item) from an Exporting_area, across a boundary or border to a different area, the Importing_area.
A Protagonist is described as being exposed to a potentially dangerous situation that may end in a Bad_outcome for him- or herself.
An Agent performs some Action which is considered imprudent.
frameExamples: He is in fact a <t>fugitive</t> of the law and you must inform the police if you see him.
Cooperating was an old term used by the Customs service to describe the illegal traffic of contrabandsold and <t>transhipped</t> from larger vessels into small local boats.
listRoleDefinitions: A numerical representation of the probability that a Hypothetical_event will occur.
A metaphorical representation of the position on the scale of likelihood that the Hypothetical_event will occur.
The event that is expected to happen with a certain likelihood.
The <fen>Fugitive</fen> has escaped and/or is evading capture by law enforcement <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is evading law enforcement.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is located.
The person who wages the <fen>Asset</fen> on a certain Outcome.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Gambler</fen> which is lost if the <fen>Gambler</fen> loses the wager.
The <fen>Gambler</fen> predicts that a certain <fen>Outcome</fen> will hold.
The <fen>Gambler</fen> predicts how an <fen>Uncertain_situation</fen> will resolve.
The time when the <fen>Gambler</fen> makes the wager.
The place where the <fen>Gambler</fen> makes the wager.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The items of value whose location is changing.
The role <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the action.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The person who is at risk of some <fen>Bad_outcome</fen>
A situation that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> would like to avoid.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protagonist</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The <fen>Action</fen> that creates the risk.
The time when the risk pertains.
The place where there is risk.
The individual that performs the <fen>Action</fen>, resulting in danger to themself.
This role denotes the <fen>Action</fen> taken by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> dares to perform the <fen>Action</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> risks doing the <fen>Action</fen>.
listRoleExamples: There's a <fex>95 %</fex> chance of rain today.
Chances are <fex>slim</fex> that he'll pull through.
He's got a small chance <fex>of making it out alive</fex>.
Only two years earlier <fex>she</fex> had been on the lam from charges of embezzlement.
He was a fugitive <fex>in the early 1990s</fex>.
Sloan, on the lam <fex>in Michigan</fex> for the last five months, is due to appear in court this Monday.
There was no risk <fex>of his returning</fex>.
The risk <fex>to his reputation</fex> was significant.
<fex>Implementing this program</fex> runs the risk of offending our core constituents.
<fex>Even after the end of Apartheit</fex> we still run the risk of letting racism continue forever.
There is always some danger to rich men <fex>in a bar like this</fex>.
I do n't think <fex>you</fex> should hazard the ascent in the dark , that 's all .
<fex>At dawn</fex>, the Captain chanced opening the hatch.
<fex>Back in his room</fex>, he risked peeking inside.
